intro: Matricaria maritima f. retzii, commonly known as the sea dandelion, is a coastal plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its yellow composite flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, aiding in its propagation along coastal areas. Its botanical features make it a hardy and resilient species suitable for coastal restoration projects.
